conclusion: Use the ideal gas law and isobaric process concept to find temperature \( T_B \).
From state A to B, pressure remains constant at \(1 \times 10^5 \, \text{Pa}\).
Identify the process from A to B as isobaric.
Convert temperature at state A from \(27^\circ\text{C}\) to Kelvin: \(T_A = 300 \, \text{K}\).
Volume at state A is \(3 \, \text{L}\) and at state B is \(4 \, \text{L}\).
The temperature \( T_B \) of state B is \(400 \, \text{K}\).
